descriptions: p:Things have gone wrong at school for your teenager, and now it’s like they have nothing left.  They’re spending their lives in their bedroom.  They have lost their sense of what made life worth living.  You don’t know how to help, and sometimes it seems like whatever you do makes things worse.  They seem angry and defensive, as well as sad and lacking in energy.
p:In this course Naomi will help you:
li:Learn what can go wrong at school for young people
li:Understand why this can be so damaging for their mental health and learn about psychological theories to understand better what is going on.
p:You will have access to this mini-course for 6 months after purchase.

p:Dr Naomi Fisher is a clinical psychologist, author and expert in trauma and autism. She has over 16 years of clinical experience, a PhD in autism and a doctorate in clinical psychology. She is registered with the Health and Care Professions Council.
p:This is a great course. Well structured and full of very insightful material. The pace was just right for me, and I found the documents very useful.

p:Thank you for appreciating the reality of the situation for parents. It really means a lot to know that there are professionals out there who really ‘get it’ and who are working so proactively to offer appropriate support and advocate for us.
p:I found your presentation both hugely informative and surprisingly comforting - there is a lot to be said for knowing you are not alone, that there are people out there who understand.
p:It was a brilliant webinar and every part of it resonated with different experiences I have had with all three of my children.
